personalInfo.name: Khushboo Singh
personalInfo.about: Hello! I’m Khushboo Singh, a Computer Science Master's student at Stony Brook University. I am passionate about solving complex problems using technology, exploring advanced machine learning models, and working with cutting-edge AI frameworks. I enjoy collaborating with teams, contributing to open-source projects, and sharing my expertise through community involvement and mentorship.

education.institution: Stony Brook University, New York, USA

education.degree: B. Tech. in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science

publications.title: Commodity Market Forecasting using Natural Language Processing
publications.conference: 25th ACM Conference on Economics and Computation

academicProjects.title: Master’s Thesis at HLAB
academicProjects.projectDescription: Investigating the Efficacy of Open Large Language Models in Understanding Human Psychological States and Traits.
details: Analyzed DS4UD dataset with various LLMs (RoBERTa, BERT, DeBERTa, GPT-2, XLNet, Llama2, Llama3, T5, FLAN T5).
Performed multi-level psychological analysis for mental health indicators, personality traits, and emotional states.
Compared embedding-based vs. prompting techniques, and evaluated autoencoders, autoregressive, encoder-decoder models.

description: Analyzed speech data with transformer-based and lexical models.
Used OpenAI’s Whisper to identify PTSD symptoms.
Supported World Trade Center Health Program’s mission on mental well-being.

awards.name: Undergraduate Research Award
awards.awardedBy: Department of Physics & Computer Science, Dayalbagh Educational Institute

leadership.organization: Sky Campus Happiness Club, Stony Brook University
